channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Auto Rollover with Entrapment; INC#1835; 10:20PM; EB 118 Fwy x 210 Fwy; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4e69F2h" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4e69F2h</a>; #Pacoima; Firefighters responded to the scene of a multi-vehicle collision, with rollover and entrapment, resulting in three people needing medical aid. Crews extricated two trapped victims from the wreckage, using hydraulic rescue tools. Both trapped patients were transported to a nearby trauma center in critical condition. A third patient was transported in moderate condition. CHP Log #2723. ; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E275 E298 E91 E98 EM15 RA75 RA91 RA98 T75 T98; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Physical Rescue; INC#1625; 07:54PM; 8808 Vista Del Mar; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/45cPjQW" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/45cPjQW</a>; #PlayaDelRey; Firefighters responded to a multi-vehicle collision resulting in at least 5 patients, including one fatality. Firefighters extricated two patients, and transported a total of four patients (3 critical & 1 in fair condition) to local hospitals (ages/genders: 18M, 16M, 18F, 30F). The deceased (unknown age/gender) remains inside one of the wrecked vehicles, with LAPD en route for the investigation.; FS 51; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC4 E205 E263 E43 E5 E62 E67 E95 EM11 EM13 EM9 HR3 RA37 RA43 RA59 RA62 RA867 RA92 RA95 T5 T63; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Physical Rescue; INC#1610; 07:44PM; 5600 N Balboa Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4c1hdBq" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4c1hdBq</a>; #Encino; Firefighters arrived to find a three-vehicle collision with entrapment. Crews deployed hydraulic rescue tools and extricated two patients. A total of three patients were evaluated/treated on scene. Two were transported in critical condition to a local trauma center (unknown age/gender). The third patient declined transport. LAPD Inc #4157. Nothing further. ; FS 83; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC10 E100 E288 E293 E83 E88 EM14 EM15 EM17 HR3 RA100 RA83 RA839 RA88 RA93 T88 T93 UR88; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1572; 07:33PM; 2455 E Cincinnati St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3xdMUc1" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3xdMUc1</a>; #BoyleHeights; Twenty-six firefighters responded to the burning unoccupied one-story home and extinguished the fire in 14 minutes, using a combination of interior fire attack and rooftop ventilation to put a swift stop to the advancing flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC2 E17 E201 E202 E25 E4 RA10 RA4 RA804 SQ21 T1 T2; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1572; 07:19PM; 2456 E Cincinnati St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4aU3z21" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4aU3z21</a>; #BoyleHeights; One-story home (vacant?) with fire showing. Offensive mode.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC2 E17 E201 E202 E25 E4 RA4 RA804 SQ21 T1 T2; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0067; 02:00AM; 2421 E Lancaster Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3x1OtK4" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3x1OtK4</a>; #BoyleHeights; Firefighters responded to a three- story residential building under construction to find heavy fire showing. Firefighters had previously been to this property for a previous fire, which presented dangers of a weakened structure and existing holes in the roof and floors. Ultimately, it took the first 32 firefighters 28 minutes to extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC11 BC13 BC2 CM20 CM22 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 E203 E25 EM1 RA1 RA2 RA801 SO1 SQ21 T1 T2 T3; CH7; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0067; 01:32AM; 2421 E Lancaster Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3x1OtK4" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3x1OtK4</a>; #BoyleHeights; Three-story residential under construction, with fire showing. Offensive mode.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC11 BC13 BC2 CM20 CM22 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 E203 E25 EM1 RA2 RA801 SO1 SQ21 T1 T2 T3; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Helicopter Hoist Rescue; INC#1504; 08:05PM; Sullivan Fire Rd; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4e59PqG" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4e59PqG</a>; #Brentwood; One adult male mountain biker sustained an injury on a remote trail (halfway up Sullivan Fire Road, west of the Westridge-Canyonback Wilderness Park). An LAFD rescue helicopter lowered a flight paramedic to medically assess and stabilize the patient, then safely hoisted them into the hovering helicopter for in-flight care during direct transport to an area hospital.; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; AO1 AO2 BC9 E19 E269 H1 H5 HA1 HA5 RA19 RH114 T69; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Update Cliff Rescue; INC#1466; 09:59PM; 4098 S Bluff Pl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/49ymf7x" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/49ymf7x</a>; #SanPedro; An LAFD Rescue Helicopter lowered an Flight Paramedic to medically assess and stabilize the 21 year-old male, who sustained a apparent back injury when he fell approximately 30' down a seaside cliff (not to the surfline) near 'Sunken City'. He will soon be hoisted along with the LAFD Flight Paramedic into the hovering LAFD Rescue Helicopter for continuing in-flight care during direct air transport to a regional trauma center.; FS 48; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; AO1 AO2 BC6 BT17 BT2 BT3 BT5 E101 E205 E248 E285 E48 E5 E85 EM13 H1 H5 HA1 HA5 RA101 RA85 RH114 T48 T5 T85 UR5 UR88; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 06/02/2024 INC#1473

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1473; 09:40PM; 4873 W Melrose Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3whMUCk" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3whMUCk</a>; #EastHollywood; 56 LAFD Firefighters took just 24 minutes in a well-coordinated offense to fully extinguish heavy fire within a vacant and boarded two-story home - the scene of a previous fire. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC11 BC5 E13 E20 E203 E226 E227 E229 E235 E27 E29 E35 E447 E52 E6 EA2 EM5 HR3 RA6 RA806 RA82 RA827 SO1 SQ21 T26 T27 T29 T3 T35 UR27; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey
